trial_identification.studytitle: Incidence of Respiratory Complications and Nausea and Vomiting following repositioning of fractures in dependence of the time of accident and the time of surgery
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Incidence of Respiratory Complications and Nausea and Vomiting following repositioning of fractures in dependence of the time of accident and the time of surgery

conditions.healthcondition: Incidence of Respiratory Complications and Nausea and Vomiting following repositioning of fractures

interventions.interventions: Incidence of respiratory complications, nausea and vomiting following repositioning of fractures in dependence of the time of accident and the time of surgery Complications and their incidence will be monitored by clinical examination. Recruitment over a period of 12 months.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Incidence of Respiratory Complications following repositioning of fractures in dependence of the time of accident and the time of surgery Assessment by clinical monitoring.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Intraoperatively and immediate recovery period until discharge

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Incidence of postoperative nausea and vomiting and pain following repositioning of fractures in dependence of the time of accident and the time of surgery Assessment by clinical monitoring.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Intraoperatively and immediate recovery period until discharge

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: patients undergoing repositioning of fractures of the arm, wrist or lower leg
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: None. There are no exclusion criteria: all patients undergoing repositioning of fractures of the arm, wrist or lower leg will be audited.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Department of Anaesthesia Roberts Road SUBIACO, WA 6008

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Department of Anaesthesia Roberts Road SUBIACO, WA 6008

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: Department of Anaesthesia Roberts Road SUBIACO, WA 6008

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this audit is to assess the incidence of nausea, vomiting and pain in children undergoing repositioning of their fractures arm/arms, lower legs in the immediate postoperative period before discharge home.

contact.name: Britta Regli-von Ungern
contact.address: Department of Anaesthesia Roberts Road SUBIACO, WA 6008
